desc: It is an honor to deliver my talk titled "Applied Data Science in Critical Infrastructure Sectors" in the 17th International Congress on Advanced Applied Informatics, IEEE.
Our team achieved Rank 4 in the Optimized Road Damage Detection Challenge (ORDDC'2024).

Our team was awarded a U.S. Patent (US 12,099,516) entitled: "Data Visualization Device and Method" for your technology focused on the development of a software tool designed to work with sensing devices to analyze data in real-time, offering users the ability to view their data through different types of visualizations that are customized to their needs and preferences.
It is an honor to have a talk as a keynote speaker in the 2nd International Conference on Cyber Intelligence and Information Retrieval (CIIR 2023)
I am so excitied to announce my newly published book on Amazon titled "Hands-On Computer Vision with Detectron2". Check it out!
Institute for Homeland Security at SHSU funded a Project titled "Deep Learning Approaches for Fingerprint Verification".
Institute for Homeland Security at SHSU funded a Project for developing a Web Application for Firemarshal First Responder.
First Springer Nature work title iDVS: interactive 2D and 3D visualizations of proximal sensor data for rapid characterization of soil profiles. It is open access!

Vung and two other undergraduate students (Du Nguyen and Christopher Donan) achieved Rank 2 (Silver Prize) as the Data Contributor and achieved Rank 3 (Bronze Prize) as the Model Contributor in the Crowdsensing-based Road Damage Detection Challenge (CRDDC2022).

Institute for Homeland Security Research Project is FUNDED. We will have a great opportunity to work on technlogies related to atuomated road damage detection, analysis, reporting, and maitenance planning.

Summer 2022 Undergraduate Research Award is FUNDED from the College of Science and Engineering Technology, Sam Houston State University. We will spend this summer working with utilizing visualization and deep learning to analyze and predict soil properties.

Vung is a staff member of Texas Higher Education Coordinating Board (THECB) Project to Address Data Science Workforce Need. I am happy to join this project and develop data science courses for undergraduate and graduate programs.

I am pleased to share our latest article, titled: Soil profile analysis using interactive visualizations, machine learning, and deep learning. This article reflects my current research well and it is also my first OPEN ACCESS journal. I highly appreciate my collaborators, Dr. Tommy Dang, Texas Tech University, and Dr. David Weindorf, Central Michigan University for your great supports and contributions.
Vung joined Sam Houston State University as a tenure-track assistant professor of Computer Science.
Vung successfully defended his Ph.D. (in CS) dissertation on June 24, 2021 and graduated on August 7, 2021.

Vung was presenting a project report to 10 NASA representatives and gathered great potentials for collaboration. This is a collaborative project between teams from Texas Tech University and Central Michigan University (Dr. David C. Weindorf). Watch part of the project here.

Vung was presenting a project report to 20 NRCS representatives. This is a collaborative project between teams from Texas Tech University and Central Michigan University (Dr. David C. Weindorf). Watch part of the project here.

Vung has just been awarded this Deep Learning Researcher certificate in recognition of his skills in: 1) Data Science, 2) Algorithmic Coding, 3) Mathematics, 4) Software Engineering, 5) Deep Learning, and 6) Machine Learning. Check out his Deep Learning Researcher certificate.

Vung has just completed AI for Medicine Specialization. This specialization has three courses: 1) AI for Medical Diagnosis, 2) AI for Medical Prognosis, and 3) AI for Medical Treatment. Check out Vung's certificate for this specialization.
Vung achieves TensorFlow Developer Certificate. Check out Vung's profile on Google Developer Certificate Network (Search for Vung).
Vung presented his work as one of the winning approaches in BigData Cup Challenges: Global Road Damage Detection Challenge 2020.
